description: Artificial Intelligence is considered from the point of view of a resource-limi knowledge-based agent who must reason and act in the world. Topics include log automatic theorem proving, search, knowledge representation and reasoning, natural language processing, probabilistic reasoning, and machine learning. Programming assignments in Python.
name: INTRO ARTIFICIAL INTELL

values.comments: Artificial Intelligence is considered from the point of view of a resource-limited knowledge-based agent who must reason and act in the world. Topics include log automatic theorem proving, search, knowledge representation and reasoning, natural language processing, probabilistic reasoning, and machine learning. Programming assignments in Python.  Many students felt that the course was “interesting” and “useful.” While several said that they learned a lot in the class, one noted that more topics could have been covered to give a clearer view of what AI is.   Students generally praised Professor Marcus as “great and entertaining” and felt that his personal anecdotes were a nice touch without becoming distracting. However, a few students found him boring and felt that the professor did little to supplement the lecture slides.  Students generally found the homework assignments interesting and the course not too difficult. Prerequisites include CIS 121 and CIS 262. Knowledge of Python is needed as well.
